critique: The document establishes military tribunals and designates members to serve on them, focusing on the trial and punishment of major war criminals. It outlines the roles and responsibilities of various government officials in providing assistance to these tribunals. There is a strong emphasis on executive action and federal control, particularly in the context of international agreements and military governance. The document reflects a focus on security and order in the aftermath of war, with less emphasis on individual liberties in the context of those accused of major war crimes.
